intro: Bupleurum purpureum, commonly known as purple bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, purple or pink flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Bupleurum purpureum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
